answers.text: evidence of each physical witness, its date, source, and relationship to other known witnesses.
Since errors tend to accumulate, older manuscripts should have fewer errors.

qas.question: What characteristic of a compilation of witnesses is the most beneficial to a textual critic?
What characteristic of a single witness is the most beneficial to a textual critic?

answers.text: more than one prior copy (exemplar) was consulted in producing the current one

qas.question: External evidence is evidence of each physical witness, its date, source, relationship to other known witnesses, and what else?
Why do critics prefer the newest witnesses?

plausible_answers.text: less likely to reflect accidents or individual biases

qas.question: Why do critics prefer minority of witnesses?

plausible_answers.text: particular care was taken in their composition

qas.question: Why do critics prefer geographically similar witnesses?
There are more early copies than what type of copies?

context: External evidence is <a0_0>evidence of each physical witness, its date, source, and relationship to other known witnesses.<a0_0/> Critics will often prefer the readings supported by the oldest witnesses. <a1_0>Since <b4_0>errors<b4_0/> tend to accumulate, older manuscripts should have <b5_0>fewer errors<b5_0/>.<a1_0/> Readings supported by a majority of witnesses are also usually preferred, since these are <b6_0>less likely to reflect accidents or individual biases<b6_0/>. For the same reasons, the most <a2_0>geographically diverse<a2_0/> witnesses are preferred. Some manuscripts show evidence that <b7_0>particular care was taken in their composition<b7_0/>, for example, by including alternative readings in their margins, demonstrating that <a3_0>more than one prior copy (exemplar) was consulted in producing the current one<a3_0/>. Other factors being equal, these are the best witnesses. The role of the textual critic is necessary when these basic criteria are in conflict. For instance, there will typically be fewer early copies, and a larger number of <b8_0>later copies<b8_0/>. The textual critic will attempt to balance these criteria, to determine the original text.
